content:
Who can help me?
I have a woman in Georgia who wants to vote for Kamala but she needs help with registration

From the text reponse for this issue: You can find general information for voting in your state at https://iwillvote.com/ If you can't find the answer there, or would just like help, call our Voter Assistance Hotline at 1-833-DEM-VOTE (1-833-336-8683). They'll be ready to help or return your call.

Hi Suzi,
Vote411.com is a great resource! It walks prospective voters through registering and creating a voting plan. Their ‚ÄúVoting in my State‚Äù program is especially helpful, as it helps them find registration deadlines, election dates, their polling place, local elections or ballot measures that are specific to their state/district, and more!

Thank you!  The lady I'm trying to help has hearing and mobility issues, so trying to resolve anything over the phone won't be optimal.  I'm trying to get ahold of someone local to help her.  I contacted the Savannah Dem office via email to see if anyone there can help.
Oh yeah, Vote411 is all online, no calling or moving necessary. I hope you can find someone local to help!
<@474644069461524481> direct her to the supervisor of elections for her county.
